name: Premier Inn Aberdeen City Centre

reviews.text: Be aware that if you check in to this hotel after 1800, the car park advertised will be full and there is absolutely nowhere to park apart from double yellow lines outside the hotel. Every evening the local "attendants" arrive and issue parking tickets to all the cars, a handy little arrangement. So please add on an extra £30.00 to your planned bill. The rooms are over priced, small, warm and the drains smell. Opening the window allows the resident the sounds of the Aberdonian night time symphony of drunks shouting, vomiting and fighting in the streets behind the hotel. Face the other way and you are on top on the main Aberdeen to Inverness road. Best give this a miss, or better still give Aberdeen a miss as it is conjested and outrageously over priced hole.
reviews.title: Over priced, small, smelly with a sting in the tail

reviews.text: Overnight stay prior to a climbing competition so didn't want to have to go outside to find food. We've eaten in a number of Thyme restaurants and I can safely say this is the best so far. Steak was perfection, baked cheesecake a delight and all for £11.99. Lovely staff as always.
reviews.title: Excellent restaurant

reviews.text: Only issue I could take would be the front of hotel rooms and noise from the street leaking through the windows. Theatre directly across from hotel was noisy when people leaving.
reviews.title: 3 and half rating for the staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in August whilst on a business trip, stayed 4 nights in total. Very central hotel in the heart of Aberdeen. Overall a nice enough hotel, I found the staff very helpful and friendly especially the breakfast staff, breakfast overall was pretty good actually, quite a full selection of hot foods, toast, croissants....perhaps could have done better with their 'continential' selection but then again I think the majority of people were having the hot breakfast, staff are very accomodating if there is something you wish to order off menu (boiled egg, poached etc).
reviews.title: Great location, comfy bed

reviews.text: The rooms are pretty basic and clean, although could do with a bit of refurb, but then you get what you pay for. Bathroom was really clean, only downside for me were the pillows!! These were so uncomfortable, there was plenty of them but they were all soft, I didn't ask for another one as assumed they would be the same, but this is a personal gripe. Otherwise rooms are fine. I did see a few reviews with people saying the rooms were hot, I cant say this was a problem at all for me, neither was it noisy and I had a room on the main road (and I am a very light sleeper) but had no problems here.
reviews.title: friendly hotel

reviews.text: Even the budget hotels in Aberdeen are less than cheap during the week - du to poor supply and high demand. However, the Premier Inn, whilst usually over £80 in the week, is better than most.
reviews.title: Usual standard -excellent for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is always spotless and I find the breakfast staff welcoming and friendly. They no longer need to show me where everything is. Whilst lacking what might be expected at more established premises this hotel does what it says - comfy bed, clean and nice breakfast. Go elsewhere for gyms, fancy eateries and bars but you will pay for it in Aberdeen.
reviews.title: City Break

reviews.text: (I know there is a restaurant but it has not been used by myself).
reviews.title: hotel..... no prison

reviews.text: Central hotel with warm and friendly service and all that you need to have an enjoyable break. Access to food and bar was helpful but there are also many places within a very short walking distance. Great location for a city break - get there early to secure parking though!
reviews.title: Another great stay at Premier Inn Aberdeen Central

reviews.text: Had to stay there for 3 days because of OE exhibition in Aberdeen, and the hotel seemed more like a prison than the hotel. When you can not open the window and no air conditioning. and the rooms are basic. I have nothing good to say about this hotel.
reviews.title: Friendly, helpful staff

reviews.text: A nice Premier Inn in a good town centre location. But don't expect to park in the hotel car park as there are only a few spaces and these get filled in the afternoon. Then there is the Aberdeen council car park which has a maximum 4 hour stay!
reviews.title: Poor parking facility.

reviews.text: Otherwise a nice hotel.
reviews.title: Welcome to Aberdeen

reviews.text: Would have like the receptionist to take the time to explain the basics, e.g. Breakfast times, location of restaurant, check out etc. No car parking available. We had to drive around to try and find somewhere to park overnight. Great if we could reserve parking. Room was basic and clean. Disappointed that wifi was not available free. Time to wake up to the modern world premier inns! Most hotels offer it free these days.
reviews.title: k smith

reviews.text: Highlight was the staff who greeted us for breakfast. An absolute star! Great staff make great hotels!
reviews.title: Good location, OK building, hit and miss staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel. Only stayed for 1 night but I would definately return. The family room was huge and the breakfast was more than sufficient. Lovely girls on reception extremely helpful providing us with a map of the area. The only down side was the car park, it fills up quickly but noticed a few people had 'abandoned' their cars outwith designated spaces and this did not seem to be a problem.
reviews.title: FRIENDLY

reviews.text: Overall the stay was average as the beds were very hard and uncomfortable with not enough pillows. The staff on the other hand were very good.
reviews.title: Beds uncomfortable and dinner menu very poor consisting of tinned and frozen food.

reviews.text: a great place to stay , only five minutes walk from the centre of Aberdeen. had an evening meal and breakfast in the attached restaurant. evening meal was great , well cooked and the staff were very attentive
reviews.title: not a bad place to lay your head !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the breakfast to me was okay, the bacon and sausage was very dry , i think that's the down side of a buffet breakfast !
reviews.title: Great Location and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the only down side for me was the amount of noise coming from the local student flats
reviews.title: Brilliant location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideally located for city centre and shopping which is why we were staying this time. Comfortable room with everything we needed. Great service at breakfast and reception. Not an excellent rating because clearly, despite no smoking laws, previous guests had been smoking in our room and because they still charge for wifi. Parking was not an issue for us as we arrived on a Sunday, but I think it maybe on other busier days
reviews.title: Great location good value for money

aka: Premier Inn Aberdeen City Centre Hotel Aberdeen
